author: Cassidy Dankochik
title: Male U18 AAA Selects pick up key wins in quest for 7th place ‚Äì The Carillon
text: Male U18 AAA Selects pick up key wins in quest for 7th place Advertisement The Eastman Selects male U18 team knows they have to avoid eighth place this year. It‚Äôs a flat year in the standings in the Manitoba AAA Hockey League, aside from the number one Brandon Wheat Kings, which have yet to lose in regulation this season. If the playoffs were to start today, Eastman would be forced to take on the juggernaut squad from Brandon, a fate the team is eager to avoid. The Selects quest to climb into seventh place got a big boost this past weekend, as the team managed to beat two teams ahead of them in the standings, defeating the seventh-place Pembina Valley Hawks 4-3 in a shootout Jan. 5, then returning to Beausejour the next day and taking down the fifth-place Winnipeg Wild 3-1. Head coach Bruce Sirrell said the team has come out of the holiday break strong, including one of their best performances of the season against the Wild. ‚ÄúIt was all four lines, three pairs and we got sharp goaltending from Sammy (Fontaine) again,‚Äù Sirrell said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm hoping we‚Äôre turning the corner. That‚Äôs two in a row for us, so we have to build on that.‚Äù The key point of the game came in the waning moments of the second period. Despite a strong first period, with Selects only give up three shots, they could only manage a 2-0 lead. Late in the second Branden Watson brought the Wild to within one, beating Fontaine on a two-on-one break. What followed was 30 seconds of pure domination from Eastman, capped off with a Jeremiah Warkentine goal. Warkentine received a pass from below the goal-line after his teammates won multiple puck battles, and made no mistake, restoring the Selects two-goal lead. Sirrell said Warkentine‚Äôs marker changed the tone of the rest of the contest. ‚ÄúThat line with (Calem) Normandeau, Warkentine and Gags (Mario Gagnon) was phenomenal all game, I think they spent the entire night in (the offensive) end,‚Äù Sirrell said, noting the line was together to start the season, but injuries and other moves had separated them as of late. ‚ÄúWe were finally able to get that line back together, and man, they dominate shifts. The 3-1 final would hold, as both teams were held scoreless in the third period. Only four points separate the Hawks and 10th-place Parkland Rangers this season. That seventh slot could be valuable for Eastman in particular, as the Selects have defeated the Southwest Cougars (currently the second place team) twice this season. ‚ÄúOutside of Brandon, everybody seems to be beating everybody,‚Äù Sirrell said. ‚ÄúSome of the higher teams have been coming back a bit. It‚Äôs a tough league. We just got to make sure we don‚Äôt take anything for granted.‚Äù Sirrell has his team aiming high in 2024, guessing they‚Äôll need to win seven out of every 10 games they play to climb up the standings. A change of the team‚Äôs systems is driving those high expectations, as the Selects look to generate more goals as the season wears on. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre giving our players a little bit more opportunity to make reads, and if they we‚Äôre going to get the puck we‚Äôre flying the zone early,‚Äù Sirrell said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre a fast team, and I think we were kind of bogged down‚Ä¶ We changed a few things around, took the seatbelt off some guys and allow them to make those reads without any repercussions on the bench.‚Äù This weekend‚Äôs action will have massive implications on the rest of Eastman‚Äôs season, as the team travels to Thompson for a back-to-back against the Norman Wolves, who sit just two points back of the Selects. ‚ÄúHopefully we can bring this same focus, and get four points out of there,‚Äù Sirrell said. ‚ÄúA split‚Äôs a split, but we need to get something out of that trip.‚Äù The male U18 selects play out of Beausejour, with their games broadcast on FloHockey.tv. The AAA regular season for Eastman is set to finish Feb. 25.

author: VNExplorer
title: 9 flood alerts in place for Nottinghamshire as Storm Gerrit to bring more rain
text:
A flood sign in the village of Collingham
There are several flood alerts in place across Nottinghamshire following the recent heavy rain from Storm Gerrit. Flooding is possible at the River Idle, River Maun, River Meden, River Trent and River Trent Tributaries.
Also at risk is the River Leen, Day Brook, Tottle Brook, the River Erewash and the River Erewash Tributaries. Storm Gerrit is bringing strong winds and heavy rain to parts of the UK, and more wet weather is expected this weekend for Nottingham.
Whilst Friday, December 29, is expected to be relatively dry, with cloudy and at some parts sunny weather, the rain is due to return over the weekend. Looking ahead to Saturday, December 30, the Met Office states: ‚ÄúA chilly start but soon turning milder with cloud increasing to bring a spell of rain through the morning.
What three words would you use to describe Nottinghamshire? Let us know
‚ÄúLargely cloudy and often dry during the afternoon, though becoming windy. Maximum temperature 10 ¬∞C.‚Äù Saturday will see highs of 10C and lows of 6C as rain is predicted throughout the day, with especially heavy rain from 8am to 11am and from 7pm to 11pm.
‚ÄúThere will be some light rain on Sunday, December 31, but the weather will predominately be cloudy. In its outlook for Sunday to Tuesday, January 2, the Met Office forecasts: ‚ÄúWindy with scattered blustery showers on Sunday.
‚ÄúProbably drier by Monday with fewer showers, though still breezy. Mainly dry with lighter winds Tuesday. Temperatures near or slightly below normal.‚Äù

author: Jace Frederick
title: Monte Morris finding his offensive aggression with Timberwolves ‚Äì Twin Cities
text: Timberwolves coach Chris Finch saw a clear silver lining in Mike Conley sitting out Wednesday‚Äôs win over Toronto, beyond the 36-year-old getting some well-deserved rest. Conley‚Äôs absence meant more run for Monte Morris. Conley is obviously the floor general for the Timberwolves. And Jordan McLaughlin‚Äôs emergence has created a few lineup combinations Finch simply has to get to on a nightly basis. That‚Äôs meant fewer minutes for Morris, who has been very good since his trade deadline acquisition. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs been playing great, but just the opportunity hasn‚Äôt been there,‚Äù Finch said. ‚ÄúSo just getting him out there with different guys, it was good to see.‚Äù And Morris took full advantage. In 25 minutes, Morris finished with 13 points ‚Äî on the strength of three triples ‚Äî five assists, four rebounds, two blocks and a steal. The Wolves outscored Toronto by 30 points when the veteran point guard was in the game. It was exactly the type of performance the Wolves wanted to see from a guard they know they‚Äôll need at the end of the regular season and beyond. Finch has noted on countless occasions that the Timberwolves need ‚Äúlow-usage, high-impact guys‚Äù to fill out their talented roster. Players who don‚Äôt need the ball in their hands, but when they get it, they‚Äôll make something happen. If anything, Finch would like to see Morris be more aggressive with his offense early in possessions. Morris is still finding the necessary comfort to call his own number. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got a lot of talented guys, so I‚Äôve got to keep finding ways, little play calls to stay into the flow of the game,‚Äù Morris said. ‚Äú(Wednesday) I called a few. Even if I wasn‚Äôt shooting it, it just gave me a feel for the game. Early on, I was deferring a lot and trying to find my way but getting lost in the sauce, just because I wasn‚Äôt being aggressive. I‚Äôve got to implement myself more into the game, whether that‚Äôs defense, rebounding, things like that. It‚Äôs been tough trying to find that flow. But I think I‚Äôve found it a little bit.‚Äù It‚Äôs not easy to join any team in the middle of a season, let alone one that‚Äôs rolling. Morris is used to playing on championship-caliber teams dating back to his days in Denver, but finding ways to insert yourself into something that‚Äôs already so good is a challenge. The last thing you want to be is a disruption. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre No. 1 (in the West) and you‚Äôre coming in to try and find your niche,‚Äù Morris said. ‚ÄúIt takes time. I just gotta keep trusting everything, keep trusting my work, getting in there every day and just keep working.‚Äù Morris said the final six games of the regular season will be ‚Äúbig‚Äù for him getting ready for the playoffs. ‚ÄúI know I‚Äôve played in big playoff games, so I know the rhythm you need to be in going into that,‚Äù Morris said. ‚ÄúSo I have to be more aggressive on that (offensive) end just so when the playoffs do come I‚Äôm in good rhythm and ready to go.‚Äù His teammates are all for it. ‚ÄúHe can really shoot the ball, and we need that,‚Äù star guard Anthony Edwards said. ‚ÄúEspecially him and J-Mac, they shoot the ball really well. So I just tell him, ‚ÄòTrust it. If you open, let it fly. Don‚Äôt think about it.‚Äô ‚Äù It‚Äôs still a work in progress, but Morris is getting there. ‚ÄúI feel like I‚Äôm handling it the best way possible. (On Wednesday), Mike didn‚Äôt play, so it was an opportunity. I didn‚Äôt want the opportunity to slip. I wanted to leave this arena, whether I made or missed shots, just in a better feel and more confident with myself,‚Äù Morris said. ‚ÄúI just know being around the league, opportunities don‚Äôt come like that a lot. I just wanted to show I‚Äôm able to play, when my number is called, a lot more minutes.‚Äù

author: Telefe C√≥rdoba
title: Dybala y Lo Celso son los elegidos para utilizar los dorsales de Messi y Di Mar√≠a - Telefe C√≥rdoba
text: El entrenador de la Selecci√≥n argentina, Lionel Scaloni, defini√≥ que Paulo Dybala y Giovani Lo Celso utilicen los dorsales que dejaron disponibles los ausentes Lionel Messi y √Ångel Di Mar√≠a. La Selecci√≥n nacional enfrentar√° esta noche a Chile y, ante la ausencia de dichos futbolistas, el DT de la "Scaloneta" design√≥ los n√∫meros que utilizar√°n los futbolistas y al nuevo capit√°n, tras no convocar al astro argentino. El emblem√°tico n√∫mero 10 qued√≥ sin due√±o -de forma provisoria-, ya que Messi a√∫n no se recuper√≥ de la lesi√≥n que sufri√≥ en la final de la Copa Am√©rica ante Colombia. En consecuencia, tambi√©n liber√≥ la capitan√≠a. Lo mismo ocurri√≥ con el dorsal 11 de Di Mar√≠a, ya que el rosarino se retir√≥ de la Selecci√≥n nacional tras la final que lo convirti√≥ en bicampe√≥n de Am√©rica. De esta manera, el entrenador decidi√≥ que para el encuentro ante Chile, Paulo Dybala tomar√° el n√∫mero 10 de Messi, mientras que Giovani Lo Celso heredar√° la 11 de ‚ÄúFideo‚Äù. Por otra parte, Nicol√°s Otamendi ser√° el capit√°n argentino ante la ausencia del jugador de Inter Miami. De esta manera, el experimentado defensor formar√° parte del equipo titular y liderar√° al plantel. "El proceso de elecci√≥n del capit√°n es en base al equipo que salga ma√±ana. Es importante que el jugador que lleve la cinta sea alguien con quien el equipo se sienta representado. Tenemos muchos jugadores que as√≠ lo hacen", explic√≥ Scaloni este mi√©rcoles en conferencia de prensa. Si bien Otamendi ya la port√≥ en algunas ocasiones, la incertidumbre pasaba por su presencia dentro del equipo inicial, algo que ya qued√≥ despejado. El defensor disput√≥ los Juegos Ol√≠mpicos de Par√≠s 2024 con la Selecci√≥n Argentina Sub-23, certamen en el que fue capit√°n.

author: Delilah Gray
title: Every Woman Prince William Reportedly Dated Before Kate Middleton
text: Prince William and Kate Middleton are one of the royal family‚Äôs most enduring love stories so it is hard to imagine that the future king had any other romantic partner before his now-wife. William and Kate met in college, back in 2001, while studying at St. Andrews University and began a friendship that soon developed into something more. ‚ÄúWe were friends for over a year first,‚Äù William told People in 2010 after the couple got engaged. ‚ÄúIt just sort of blossomed from then on.‚Äù They became roommates, with a group of friendship, before embarking on a romance in 2002. ‚Äú[We] realized we shared the same interests,‚Äù William explained. ‚Äú[We] just had a really good time.‚Äù After over two decades together, it is hard to remember a time before Will and Kate. However, if you dig back a little further, there was a time when William was known as a bit of a heartthrob. Despite the Prince and Princess of Wales having a fairytale-esque romance story, it wasn‚Äôt all royal jewels and family vacations. It seemed like William would never settle down, but now he and Kate have three kids, a gorgeous home, and are steadily on the path to becoming King and Queen. While a lot of royal relationships can‚Äôt be confirmed or denied unless they make an official royal outing, William was linked to quite a few classmates, notable society members and, erm, even a distant cousin (we‚Äôll get to that too‚Ä¶) Check out every woman William has reportedly dated before he and Kate tied the knot in 2011! A version of this article was originally published on Nov 28, 2022. - 1999: Davina Duckworth-Chad Though their alleged fling was never confirmed, William was briefly linked to family friend Davina Duckworth-Chad in 1999. Per the Daily Mail, Duckworth-Chad and William were linked in 1999 after she joined the future king on a cruise ship, dubbed a ‚Äúlove boat‚Äù in the Aegean Sea. Not much is known, except for the fact that they‚Äôre technically related. According to E! News, her mom is Princess Diana‚Äôs cousin. - 2000: Rose Farquhar According to the Daily Mail , William dated his ‚Äúfirst love‚Äù aspiring singer Rose Farquhar in 2000 after meeting at the Beaufort Polo Club in Gloucestershire. Their relationship reportedly began not long after William finished his A-levels at Eton before his pre-college gap year. Rose is the youngest daughter of Captain Ian Farquhar, who died in 2024, a longtime friend of King Charles who once served as an equerry to Queen Elizabeth‚Äôs mother. In the years after their romance, William and Rose reportedly remained friends and Will even attended her 2022 wedding. - 2000-2001: Jecca Craig Jecca Craig and William met back in 1998 in Kenya during a school holiday but reportedly didn‚Äôt start dating until 2000 during William‚Äôs pre-college gap year. The two split before William headed off to St. Andrews but remained friends, even reuniting briefly on a family trip in 2004 while Kate and Will were allegedly on a break. Their friendship allegedly didn‚Äôt go over well with Kate. According to the book Brothers and Wives: Inside the Private Lives of William, Kate, Harry, and Meghan, Kate was allegedly tired of being ‚Äúthreatened and humiliated‚Äù by her boyfriend and his friendship with his ex and insisted he distance himself from her. - 2001: Arabella Musgrave William and Arabella Musgrave reportedly dated in 2001, during his final summer before going to college. Vanity Fair‚Äôs royal correspondent Katie Nicholls reported that the pair, who had known one another peripherally since childhood, connected at a party before embarking on a whirlwind romance. ‚ÄúAs she walked through the house party at the van Cutsems‚Äô family home, William did a double take,‚Äù Nicholls wrote in 2010 . ‚ÄúThey danced and drank into the early hours, and when Arabella said her good-nights, the prince quietly slipped out of the room to follow her upstairs. It was the beginning of a passionate romance, and the two spent as much time together that summer as possible.‚Äù The pair reportedly mutually agreed to end their relationship once William‚Äôs first semester at St. Andrews began. Musgrave‚Äôs went on to become the head of PR at Gucci. - 2001: Carly Massy-Birch Carly Massy-Birch and William were reportedly together for about ‚Äúsix or seven weeks when they first arrived at St Andrews,‚Äù per her parents. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a real country bumpkin,‚Äù Massy-Birch later said, via Katie Nicholl in Vanity Fair. ‚ÄúI think that was why we had a connection. William was in the year below, and we just happened to meet through the general St. Andrews melee. It‚Äôs such a small place that it was impossible not to bump into William, and after a while, there was nothing weird about seeing him around. We got on well, but I think we would have got on well even if nothing had been going on romantically. It was very much a university thing, just a regular university romance.‚Äù - 2001: Olivia Hunt William allegedly also dated aspiring writer-now-journalist Olivia Hunt during their first year at St. Andrews. Actually, they were dating right at the time William met Kate, but there was no bad blood. In fact, per https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-448603/The-girl-make-Kate-jealous.htmlthey‚Äôre all pretty good friends to this day! - 2003: Bryony Daniels William was briefly linked to fellow St. Andrews student Bryony Daniels in 2003 while the pair were moving in the same social circle. However, when William and Kate‚Äôs relationship was first publicized in 2004, it was reported that the couple had been secretly dating for a year so we‚Äôre guessing Daniels was never anything more than a friend. - 2004: Isabella Anstruther-Gough-Calthorpe According to the Daily Mail, William briefly pursued millionaire heiress Isabella Calthorpe in 2004 during a brief break in his romance with Kate. ‚ÄúWilliam said he needed a break and that summer he went on a boys-only holiday to the Greek Islands,‚Äù a source alleged . ‚ÄúIsabella was very much on the scene that summer. I would go so far as to say that William dumped Kate because he thought he had a chance with Isabella and Kate knew that.‚Äù The source went on to claim that Calthorpe, who is now married to billionaire Richard Branson‚Äôs son Sam, rejected William‚Äôs advances. ‚ÄúHe had fallen for her in a huge way and wanted to be with her. He propositioned her several times that summer and although Isabella was single, she knocked William back and said it would be too damaging for her and her career,‚Äù the source claimed, stating that Kate waited for William and took him back on the condition that he never speak to Calthrope again. - 2004: Anna Sloan Royal author Katie Nicholl‚Äôs 2010 book William and Harry, via Express UK , Calthorpe wasn‚Äôt the only woman William pursued in 2004. Nicholl‚Äôs called the break with Kate a ‚Äútrial separation‚Äù that the pair agreed to do before reuniting. During that time, William alleged grew close to American heiress Anna Sloan. However, a romance never blossomed. - 2006: Natasha Hamilton Newspapers had a field day when Natasha Hamilton, an ex-member of the pop group Atomic Kitten, and William looked like they were making out at the Prince‚Äôs Trust 30th anniversary concert in 2006. She told the Sun per Female First, ‚ÄúIt looks like I‚Äôm going in for the kiss. But I really was not. It‚Äôs all rather unfortunate. You‚Äôve got to laugh it off.‚Äù And that‚Äôs all there is to it - 2007: Ana Ferreira After William reportedly dumped Kate Middleton over the phone in 2007, he was seen out partyingwith a woman named Ana Ferreira, per https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8973627/How-William-Kates-relationship-hit-rocks-Prince-weighed-expectation.html. However, they were never seen again and Will and Kate ended up reuniting for good in June 2007.

author: @business_today
title: ISRO nails autonomous landing experiment of Reusable Launch Vehicle, big boost for orbital re-entry missions - BusinessToday
text: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on June 23 said it has achieved a third consecutive success in the Reusable Launch Vehicle Landing Experiment by demonstrating the autonomous landing capability of the launch vehicle under more challenging conditions. ‚ÄúPushpak executed a precise horizontal landing, showcasing advanced autonomous capabilities under challenging conditions. With the objectives of RLV LEX accomplished, ISRO embarks into RLV-ORV, the orbital reusable vehicle,‚Äù ISRO said in a post on X (formally Twitter). Related ArticlesISRO and Wipro 3D partner for space exploration with 3D-printed rocket engine'Another milestone': ISRO rocket accomplishes zero orbital debris missionAfter Chandrayaan-3 success, ISRO to launch Chandrayaan-4 in 2 phases. Check details here Hat-trick for ISRO in RLV LEX! üöÄüáÆüá≥ISRO achieved its third and final consecutive success in the Reusable Launch Vehicle (RLV) Landing EXperiment (LEX) on June 23, 2024."Pushpak" executed a precise horizontal landing, showcasing advanced autonomous capabilities under‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com\/cGMrw6mmyH‚Äî ISRO (@isro) June 23, 2024This mission simulated the approach and landing interface and high-speed landing conditions for a vehicle returning from space, reaffirming the Indian Space Research Organisation's expertise in acquiring the most critical technologies required for the development of a Reusable Launch Vehicle, the space agency said. In a release, ISRO said the RLV LEX-03 re-demonstrated the autonomous landing capability of the RLV under more challenging release conditions and more severe wind conditions. The winged vehicle, named ‚ÄòPushpak‚Äô, was released from an Indian Air Force Chinook Helicopter at an altitude of 4.5 km ‚Äúfrom a release point 4.5 km away from the runway. Pushpak autonomously executed cross-range correction manoeuvres, approached the runway and performed a precise horizontal landing at the runway centreline,‚Äù it said. It added that this mission simulated the approach and landing interface and high-speed landing conditions for a vehicle returning from space, reaffirming ISRO‚Äôs expertise in acquiring the most critical technologies required for the development of a Reusable Launch Vehicle (RLV). ‚ÄúThrough this mission, the advanced guidance algorithm catering to longitudinal and lateral plane error corrections, which is essential for the future Orbital Re-entry Mission has been validated,‚Äù the space agency said.
